channel.title: Whats' the format to like...telly you when u click something
channel.description: ok... basically.... im doing jad different on my private server.... i have the telly take you outside of the brimhaven dungeon entrance... but I want it to teleport you somewhere when you click "enter dugneon" but idk how to do that.... ik it has to do with the "clicking buttons" file... i just don't know what to put into it.. so please dont troll me saying "figure it out kid" because i find it wrong to do that when someone comes to the "server help" section to just so wrongly deny them of any help and expect them to figure it out on their own.. im not asking to be spoonfed i just wanna know what the like base code for this command is... please and thank you.. if you need this additonal info here it is.... [code] OBJECT ID : 5083 XCOORDS OF OBJECT : 2743 Y COORDS : 3153 [/code] i appreciate any help you give me as long as it's not bull shit like "figure it out for yourself" or any variation of that

item.title: Whats' the format to like...telly you when u click something
item.dc:creator: @Tylerd21 Tylerd21
item.description:
@Tylerd21 wrote:

Well, usually in PI you’re wanting an object to move you somewhere it’d be like this.

case ####: movePlayer(####,####,#); break;

That’s usually in Actionhandler.java

If you’re using something different, It’s very relevant to it.
Search for words like, teleport, move, etc.

Read full topic
item.source: Whats' the format to like...telly you when u click something

item.title: Whats' the format to like...telly you when u click something
item.dc:creator: @whogoesthere whogoesthere
item.description:
@whogoesthere wrote:

ok… basically… im doing jad different on my private server… i have the telly take you outside of the brimhaven dungeon entrance… but I want it to teleport you somewhere when you click “enter dugneon” but idk how to do that… ik it has to do with the “clicking buttons” file… i just don’t know what to put into it… so please dont troll me saying “figure it out kid” because i find it wrong to do that when someone comes to the “server help” section to just so wrongly deny them of any help and expect them to figure it out on their own… im not asking to be spoonfed i just wanna know what the like base code for this command is… please and thank you… if you need this additonal info here it is… OBJECT ID : 5083 XCOORDS OF OBJECT : 2743 Y COORDS : 3153 i appreciate any help you give me as long as it’s not bull shit like “figure it out for yourself” or any variation of that

Read full topic
